paper_title.ja: 沸騰開始におけるぬれの重要性
paper_title.en: The Importance of Wetting in Boiling Inception

description.ja: There will be two ways of boiling inception, depending on whether or not vapor nuclei can survive in micro-cavities on a heater surface. The important factors that govern their survival are the wetting of the liquid (contact angles), the shape of the cavities and the presuppression. Little knowledge about both contact angles and shape of micro-cavities has prevented progress of researches for a long time. Very recently, however, the experiments with a heated platinum wire have proved that boiling inception in ethanol is generally caused by spontaneous nucleation. In special situations where the platinum wire continues to be superheatd above an extent throughout the non-boiling period, boiling inception is brought about by a surviving vapor nucleus. It will be needless to say that the explosive growth of surviving vapor nuclei causes boiling inception in water. In addition, smaller vapor nuclei generally tend to collapse easier in ethanol, whereas harder in water. The above results can be attributed to the difference between poorly wetting water and well wetting ethanol.
description.en: There will be two ways of boiling inception, depending on whether or not vapor nuclei can survive in micro-cavities on a heater surface. The important factors that govern their survival are the wetting of the liquid (contact angles), the shape of the cavities and the presuppression. Little knowledge about both contact angles and shape of micro-cavities has prevented progress of researches for a long time. Very recently, however, the experiments with a heated platinum wire have proved that boiling inception in ethanol is generally caused by spontaneous nucleation. In special situations where the platinum wire continues to be superheatd above an extent throughout the non-boiling period, boiling inception is brought about by a surviving vapor nucleus. It will be needless to say that the explosive growth of surviving vapor nuclei causes boiling inception in water. In addition, smaller vapor nuclei generally tend to collapse easier in ethanol, whereas harder in water. The above results can be attributed to the difference between poorly wetting water and well wetting ethanol.

paper_title.en: Effect of non-condensable gas on condensation in a highly-rotating drum with a scraper

description.en: The effect of non-condensable gas on condensation in a highly rotating drum with a scraper is explored analytically. The formulation is first carried out generally, and then the application of the general formulation to the steam-air system gives heat transfer results for a wide range of operating conditions. It is found that a very small amount of non-condensable gas can induce a significant reduction in heat transfer. The reduction is accentuated at larger temperature differences, thinner condensate thickness and, to one's surprise, at higher operating pressures. By comparison, it is indicated that the present situation is more sensitive to non-condensable gas than forced convection condensation along a horizontal plate. © Springer-Verlag 1998.
